text: Magyar Kupa () is the main domestic cup for Hungarian women's team handball clubs, which is organized and supervised by the Hungarian Handball Federation. The competition is held annually, starting in September and concluding in April. The teams play in a one-leg knockout system with a final four tournament in the end. The winner of the Hungarian cup get the right to participate in the next year's EHF Cup Winners' Cup, unless they secure a place in the EHF Champions League. If happens so, then the runners-up take the opportunity to represent Hungary in the forthcoming continental event for cup winners. ==Winners== In 1954 and 1955 the cup was held on a grand scale. In 1983 they played two series (in February and December). In 1967, 1968, 1985 and 1986 the finals were played only in the following year. Previous cup winners are: * 1951: Magyar Posztó * 1952: Magyar Posztó * 1953: Vörös Meteor * 1954: Vörös Meteor * 1955: Ferencváros * 1956: Bp. Szikra * 1957–62: Not Played * 1963: Bp.
